bibl.title: Writ, John Sevier to Sheriff of Washingtion Co, North Carolina, 1783

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: To the Sheriff of Washington Co

We command you to take James Ashmore and Hezekiah Ashmore (planters) if to be found in your Bailwick and them safely keep so that you have them before the Justices of our County Court of pleas and Quarter Sessions to be Held on the first Monday in August next then & there to answer William Trimble in a plea on the case of damage one Thousand pounds Specie, Herein fail not and Have you there this Writ. Witness John Sevier Clerke of our Said Court at his office, The first Monday in May anno Domini 1783
